Title: Anna Christie
Notes: Garbo's first talkie and first Academy Award nomination for Best Actress

Title: Romance
Notes: Nominated – Academy Award for Best Actress

Title: Anna Christie
Notes: MGM's German version of Anna Christie was also released in 1930; Salka Viertel, Garbo's close friend, later co-wrote several of her screenplays.

Title: Mata Hari
Notes: After the multi-star Grand Hotel, Garbo's highest-grossing film

Title: Grand Hotel
Co-star: John Barrymore, Lionel Barrymore, Joan Crawford, Wallace Beery

Title: As You Desire Me
Notes: First of three movies with Douglas

Title: Anna Karenina
Notes: New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Actress

Title: Camille
Notes: New York Film Critics Circle Award for Best Actress National Board of Review Best Acting Award Nominated – Academy Award for Best Actress

Title: Conquest
Notes: Because the final cost for this extravagant production vastly exceeded its budget, coupled with its poor box office receipts, the film lost $1,397,000.
